- Fixed length array
- Checkpoint iteration count

div.font: - Last block from latest checkpoint as head

div.style: font-family: "courier new" ; font-weight: 700 ; font-size: 13px

div.div: - Each block could OWNs multiple children

div.style: font-family: "courier new" ; font-weight: 700 ; font-size: 13px

div.div: - Each block as exactly one pointer to its parent

div.style: font-family: "courier new" ; font-weight: 700 ; font-size: 13px

div.div: - A key-value hash map for quick block look-up when appending new block to the active block

div.style: font-family: "courier new" ; font-weight: 700 ; font-size: 13px
font-family: "courier new" ; font-weight: 700 ; font-size: 13px

div.div: - A active block means based on difficulty estimation, it can still have new child block without failing the difficulty check

div.style: font-family: "courier new" ; font-weight: 700 ; font-size: 13px

div.div: - Based on the estimation, if a block cannot be extended, it will marked as inactive, and it will be removed from this map

div.style: font-family: "courier new" ; font-weight: 700 ; font-size: 13px
font-family: "courier new" ; font-weight: 700 ; font-size: 13px

div.div: - Move confirmed chain into the fixed-length array
